thread.title: Sean Spicer is being trolled on Venmo
thread.title_full: Sean Spicer is being trolled on Venmo | Daily Mail Online

author: Anna Hopkins For Dailymail.com
title: Sean Spicer is being trolled on Venmo
text:
Cheeky Twitter users have discovered that Sean Spicer has a public profile on the money-trading app Venmo and have been inundating him with hilarious requests.
People have been trolling the White House Press Secretary on the app, which allows users to send or request money from you, and sharing screenshots of their jibes on Twitter.
Many reference his odd characteristics which have made headlines in recent weeks, including his bizarre rift with the ice cream company Dippin Dots and habit for chewing two packs of gum every day before noon.
Cheeky Twitter users have discovered that Sean Spicer has a public profile on the popular money-trading app Venmo, which allows other users to send or request money from you
Many reference his odd personal and political characteristics which have made headlines in recent weeks, including his bizarre rife with the ice cream company Dippin Dots and habit for chewing two packs of gum every day before noon
A few users poked fun at the gaff made by Kellyanne Conway's 'alternative fact' in which she referenced 'masterminds behind the Bowling Green Massacres' - an event which never happened
Spicer himself also made a series of publicly misleading statements about Donald Trump's inauguration numbers
Many billed him for medical and mental health costs they anticipate facing Donald Trump's impending repeal of Obamacare.
Others focused on the 'anxiety meds' they need caused by the stress of Trump's presidency.
More harped on the fact that Hillary Clinton received more popular votes than President Trump during the election.
A few users poked fun at the gaff made by Kellyanne Conway's 'alternative fact' in which she referenced 'masterminds behind the Bowling Green Massacres' - an event which never happened.
Spicer himself also made a series of publicly misleading statements about Donald Trump's inauguration numbers.
He stated that it was the 'most publicly viewed inauguration of all time' - however, the numbers blatantly say differently.
One user asked him for 'Alternative Tax' on Venmo.
Taking a poke at Spicer referencing 'alternative facts', this user sent a request for 'Alternative Tax'
More harped on the fact that Hillary Clinton received more popular votes than President Trump during the election
The app, which allows other users to send or request money from you, has been inundated with hilarious fees directed at the White House Press Secretary
This Venmo user takes a stab at Spicer's stance on abortions
A new closet: One user offered to help kit him out in new threads, along with some assistance from 'the gays'
Many billed him for medical and mental health costs they anticipate facing Donald Trump's impending repeal of Obamacare
Another user shared a $5,200 donation for therapy for the White House man
Spicer has had his fair share of technological problems since breaking into the political sphere.
Until recently, his personal website, SeanSpicer.com, was listed on his Twitter profile. The site has since been deleted, but it was revealed that whoever was responsible for deleting his site accidentally made the WHOIS information public.
WHOIS details the extremely private information for the person who established the site, in this case Spicer, including his home address and telephone number.
It is also suspected that he accidentally tweeted the password to his Twitter account on more than one occasion.
Sean Spicer took the podium in the White House on Tuesday afternoon for the first time since he was impersonated by Melissa McCarthy
Melissa McCarthy playing Sean Spicer has proved to be a huge hit for Saturday Night Live
Spicer told The Washington Post during an interview in August 2012 that he chews and swallows 2 packs of gum before noon every morning.
His gum of choice, according to the profile, is Orbit cinnamon.
He said: 'Two and a half packs by noon.
'I talked to my doctor about it, he said it's no problem.'
Spicer gave his first press conference today at the White House since being impersonated by actress comedienne Melissa McCarthy on Saturday Night Live.
However he did not reference the skit during the conference.
